Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean, and Luxurious--a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle Q
Reviews.Content: So, I'm wondering if we stayed in the same place as the rest of the reviewers because our experience with this hotel was absolutely perfect. After reading the reviews, and travelling for a couple weeks and staying in hostels, we weren't expecting much. We were even warming up to the idea of an open shower, as we read from some of the other reviews of the this place. We got in by train at the Termini Station and the WRH Suites were conveniently located a 5 minutes walk away. Checking in was kind of tricky. I believe we had to go to the 5th floor to check in but our room was actually on the 3rd floor. WRH owns 2 floors at the other floor is another hotel. When we got to our room, it was absolutely luxury! There was a queen bed with fresh linens, marble flooring, pretty drapes, a flatscreen TV, and breakfast laid out. The bathroom was equally as nice; everything was updated and the shower...oh the shower was the best part. Instead of the usual spout it was a circular faucet with streams of water shooting you in a circle on your head. Which seems weird now that I've typed it out...but it was AMAZING. Beyond that, everything in the suite was super clean--and I'm somewhat OCD about cleanliness. The location of this hotel is great. Because you're right next to Termini, you can easily take public transportation. The only thing is, the station can get a little sketchy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good, well priced and centrally located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and we enjoyed our stay. The negatives were: 1. The room - our booked room smelled like an ashtray as the previous guest clearly was a smoker. We changed rooms as a result. 2. The shower - in our original room was right in the middle of the room and did not have a shower curtain or frosted door.... 3. The Metro - a streetcar runs right past the hotel, starting as early as 6am; not that we wanted to sleep all day while in Rome, however an unrequested 6am wake-up call wasn't the way we liked to start our days. The positives were: 1. Location - this place is a 5 minute walk from the Roma Termini (train station) and is also located right across the street from a police station; a very central and safe location. 2. The Staff - both guys working at the front desk were very knowledgeable about Rome, and very accommodating when it came to things like checkout and holding our luggage etc. 3. The Elevator - while not the biggest or fastest hotel elevator I have ever been in, it just had that "european" feel to it. 4. The Price - Rome is not cheap, the city and with the Euro exchange rates. This hotel cost us $150 Euro a night. When walking around, we stopped into the Best Western nearby to check their rates, and the cheapest they had was $200 Euro a night. Upon a return to Rome, I would consider this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, basic and centrally located Rome apartment.”
Reviews.Author: bearrrwillie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the the WRH one bedroom apartments, there is a small lift as reception is on the 4th floor. First, off I have to highlight to any first time visitors, Rome is not a cheap city for the tourist. I am convinced there are tourist prices and local prices. If you speak Italian, use it I think it will save you money. These apartments compared to the Roman Hotel prices we were offered on line, gave very good value for money. The fridge and kitchenette saw significant savings on food, drink and eating out, which can be pricey in Rome. Example; 6 soops of albeit, very nice ice cream between 3 people was Euro 18.00 about £16.00 Sterling! Check out the wine in the supermarkets, a very nice Merlot for 5 Euro! Andrea on the small reception, was very friendly and welcoming. He met us at the elevator and helped with our bags. The check in was quick, despite all the Italian paper work and we were allowed in the apartment, on arrival at 12 noon. The apartment was basically suitable for the money paid, but could have been so much better with some simple improvements. A coat of fresh paint, removing of some of the very dated furnishings and some better cleaning would have given this place a good rating, instead of average. We think the turn around on our arrival and the previous guests leaving, saw some corner cutting on the cleaning. The bathroom was very clean and the bedding and towels all fresh, however the kitchen area and floors were not cleaned well enough. They failed to spot what looked like an exploded Coke bottle in the freezer. Although in itself not 'dirty' it looked rather horrible on inspection and should have been cleaned up. The apartment was fully air conditioned in the bedroom and living room and believe me this was needed in the August heat, some days up to 38C (100F?). It was a split air con system so very quiet, which was needed as our apartment faced a street with a tram / light rail that started most mornings about 0530. Even with the double glazed windows, it was rather loud. Myself and another party member have no trouble using ear plugs, so it did not bother us. Another party member slept through it without ear plugs, so the noise levels, effects people to different degrees. All the other basics were there and worked well, including the good WiFi service. Italian TV is simply appalling, so did not bother with it. There was always hot water and additional toiletries that were needed were provided on request. The bedding was adequate, but not luxurious. Excluding the tram, there was not too much other ambient noise, other than what you would expect from a large apartment building in a busy city central location and not anything that bothered any of us. The location is one of the big selling points here. It is just two short blocks from Termini Station and is very easy to find and well labelled with a distinctive name plaque on the doorway. It is within a 20-30 minute walk or less of many of the big tourist hotspots. We walked in the heat to the Trevi, Spanish Steps, Colosseum and Pantheon. By the way please take a couple of evening walks, the city is particularly lovely on those warm balmy Summer nights. The Trevi and Colosseum are just spectacular at night! The area is well serviced by restaurants and shops of all kinds. The apartment building is a block from the Church, Santa Maria Maggorie, and from the other side of the Church you can pick up several tour buses. We opted for the 'Cristiana' Tour company (yellow coloured bus livery) as they had an awning on their 'open topped' bus that shaded you from the blazing Summer sun. They also offered a two for one deal with the Sistine Chapel, Vatican Museum entry ticket and a 48 hour step on and off bus ticket, for 42 Euro which seemed a good deal to us. There is also a supermarket just opposite the front of the church that proved very useful. The bottom line is, this is centrally located basic, in need of some cosmetic improvements, apartment and it delivers value for money. We paid about Euro 600 between 3 people for 5 nights. If your looking for a bit of luxury, give this place a miss. However, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as the pictures look”
Reviews.Author: mb25b
Reviews.Content: The location was really good - close to restaurants, the train station and other transportation to get around the city. The room wasnt that bad but don't expect to get a nice a room as the pictures shows. In our room the fridge was barely working the computer surplied was fully screwed up. They also use fancy words like hydro massage spa bath and rain shower for a bath and shower so don't fall for that.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, big junior suite room”
Reviews.Author: andrit2010
Reviews.Content: 5 min from termini station, booked junior suites, room is clean, big, bright and great. I emailed directly to hotel and they gave me discount for single occupacy for junior suite and gave me further discount for paying in cash..i ended up only paying 100e per nite net incl the tax. The suite is at level 4, the only issue is only the small and old lift..but it;s work fine coz the building is not that busy. other issue us the funny shower/jaccuzi is outside the bathroom if you are solo traveler or couple is ok, but this room is not recomended if you stay with freind unless you ok with shower naked in front of your freind....the wifi is working fine and fast...at night is quite and I can slept well.... there are many restaurant outside but they are all overpriced as the customer most of them are tourist. Be aware that those price in t hat restaurant menu are ex tax....the recieption spoken english very well....aircon it abit weak for hot summer..but I am used to with hot so no problem with me and most of place in rome i.e shopping center has weak aircon anyway..unless those in asia.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: joani1806
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on a web site and were very happy with our choice. We stayed in the apartment room which gave up a kitchen and living room area. This location is perfect for seeing all that Rome has to offer--can walk everywhere from here. Room was clean and beds were fine. There is internet access in the room which was great as we were booking hotels as we travelled and could search for our next location right from the room. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in a big city”
Reviews.Author: bully27
Reviews.Content: This is a great find, The staff are so friendly & it's so close to the station, we would love to stay there next time we go to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Termini Station, Helpful reception But poor condition of bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: vitamin_kin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the twin-sharing room recently and we are disappointed. Typical style of Rome. Small lifts only allows two small size adults and limited luggage. The pictures shown on the website is a bit misleading, the room is definitely not as clean and new as we thought it would be. There are some stains on the walls but still this was not so bad.. the unbearable was the leaking sink, mouldy shower area and the poor ventilation in the bathroom. Poor ventilation causes the room to have an unpleasant smell. We stayed there for 3 nights, and the heater failed to work on one of the nights. The breakfast provided is simple nothing to expect. For the amount that we are paying for we believe there are better choices. There is free WIFI connection and it is fast. The reception is helpful, he recommended us to cheap and good family run restuarants. He is also helpful with the directions and places of interest. In conclusion, If u are looking for slightly more than just a room for you to shower and to sleep this is not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “NICE TRICKY PICTURES BUT STAY AWAY ... DIRTY & NOISY PLACE”
Reviews.Author: lolodimilano
Reviews.Content: The first impression (nice & modern building) is the one and only good point about this place, apart from its central location (easy to move within Rome). Then you realize that pictures presenting the place are misleading : it's not that design and modern and would deserve a refreshment of furniture; but more than anything towels and sheets! On top of this, the bathtub and the sink are really very close from the bed; and when you sell a room for 3, they should tell you that there is no real bathroom, but shower/bathtub in the room! It is dirty and bad smells (and dark water) come out from the bathtub. Noise from the street, but worse from the trains until late in the night and very early in the morning, do not let you sleep well, furthermore when the heating system does not work well and you freeze at night in autumn ... what shall it be in winter? last but not least, the food left for "breakfast" is not worth this wording and the space for breakfast is dirty and boiling stuff doesn't work. So finally, I left with my 2 children after the first night, losing the 2nd night, but I really could not stand it anymore. As you can read from this, really a place to avoid in Roma, unless you don't care about privacy, cleanliness & noise.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiCoupleHastingsNZ
Reviews.Content: This was the BEST place we stayed while we were in Europe. These suites are the whole package; the rooms were lovely, everything was clean and the service was outstanding! We would recommend to everyone and would definitley stay again. Many thanks to the AWESOME staff who made our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Kisak
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Staff was very nice and helpful. The room was clean. Pizzeria Santi next door was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean modern rooms and exceptionally helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AlanCaswell
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay in Rome. It was literally two minutes walk from the train station. The staff contacted me before I travelled and they waited until I arrived which was quite late. Although it was late when I arrived, it was a safe walk from the train station and the hotel was right by a police station for added security. I stayed in this hotel twice during my stay in Italy and tried two different rooms, both were very modern looking, clean and spacious. The rooms also came with a laptop and free wireless internet which was very useful and meant that I didn't need to bring a laptop with me. Both the double rooms I stayed in had jacuzzi baths with were very nice after tiring days sightseeing. The reception staff were very very helpful and friendly and could give you advice on location of places. They also looked after my bag on the check out day until I was ready to collect my bag and start my trip home. It's a small hotel with only a few rooms, so you are provided with a nice breakfast basket which was sufficient and there is a shared kitchen area too. The location by the train station meant that it was easy access for the airport, easy access to the tourist buses which depart by the train station and easy access for a day trip to Pompeii which also left by the train station. It took me about 15-20 minutes to walk from the hotel to the Colosseum and the Foro Romano and it was quite an easy direct walk, although I did also buy one of those tourist bus passes which made it easy to see the sights and get around Rome and easy to get back to the hotel as the bus stopped by the train station. I would recommend this hotel to people, the rooms are very nice and spacious and the price is good too, the staff are exceptionally helpful and friendly and the location is ideal. The hotel meant I had a comfortable visit to Rome and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A well-located hotel with a pleasing mix of old and new”
Reviews.Author: Sylvie003
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the junior suite at WRH for three nights following a cruise so we could spend our anniversary in Rome. We were very pleased with the room and loved the beautiful windows which we opened for the fresh air and the pleasure of hearing the city around us. There was a laptop and internet access in the room. Gioberto was very welcoming and helped us with directions and dinner reservations. All the sites that travelers most want to see are in walking distance and the hotel is an easy walk to the train station. There is a little market directly across the street with fresh fruit; and a grocery store for essentials such as wine, beer and liquor. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: iloveeu
Reviews.Content: The hotel was one of the hotels we particularly liked as the room was very nicely decorated and designed, the location was really near Roma Termini Station so it was really accessible. We greatly appreciated the service provided by the staff especially for having to wait for our arrival even after his shift, to make sure that we are properly accommodated in the hotel. We also appreciated the travel tips the staff gave us during our stay in the hotel. We also particularly like the laptop and internet access in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: gems008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the WRH Suites in February 2010. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, our room was spotless and the staff were very helpful. A laptop and internet in the room was a good bonus too. I had read some reviews online which said to be wary of the location, but we found the location to be perfect - it was easy enough to walk everywhere, and when we needed to get the metro we were right beside it. I'd also read reviews that said it was noisy - we weren't bothered by noise in the slightest. The breakfast isn't much so be prepared for that. Our only downside was that we had booked a double room and instead got two twin beds pushed together, which wasn't ideal - or very comfortable! I brought it to the attention of the staff who said that most of the rooms were like that, and they did offer to move us a day later. But it might be worth specifying that you want a double bed. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the WRH suites. It has a good location, is incredibly clean, has great staff and is a nice change from a regular hotel. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff, good hotel in decent price.”
Reviews.Author: latexdragon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights, and needed spacious room. Unfortunately I had reserved the apartment right after others, so the info hadn´t reached the site yet. I was right away informed about double booking and was offered upgraded room for the first 2 nights (suite) and they even promised to make necessary preparations for me. Points for that in the start. The place is very conveniently located just near the Termini station, there are loads of restaurants and shops around, and the Colosseum is just a short walk away. So very good location. I think the area was relatively safe, at least I had no problems when I walked later outside, but maybe not for every single female to make late night strolls... Building itself is quite old and not fancy, but the hotel, rooms and apartment are nicely done. The elevator may look fearsome for someone, but it´s only outside. It works very well and is very quiet. Rooms were clean, and though nothing fancy, everything worked and there were no eyesores. Toilets were very clean and especially in the suit very nicely done. In all I liked the both the suite and the apartment. Points also for free use of wi-fi and for the computers in the rooms. Only problems were, that the apartment was quite cold during my stay there, and the noise from the street may bother some. I didn´t find the noise a problem myself, slept very well. Breakfast is not much, but You can start Your day with it, and there is common kitchen area where You can have coffee and use micro if You wish. In all I enjoyed my stay there very much, and would say, that the staff deserves extra thanks for all their helpfulness. They are not at the site all the time, but they can be reached via phone, and are very willing to help with any problems You have. Next time I´m heading to Rome I´ll gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, affordable hotel near train station”
Reviews.Author: Adam35
Reviews.Content: Good location less than five minutes from train station and within walking distance of most major attractions. The staff were very helpful and responsive both before and after we arrived. There's a good little coffee shop around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “luxury for an excellent price”
Reviews.Author: ExtraordinarySpark
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have stayed in to date The room was clean and the air conditioning was a god send during the scorching summer. The room was stocked with a selection of snacks and drinks to avail of and there was a communal kitchen area where tea or coffee could be mad. The laptop was very useful at night as I brought my own dvds to entertain myself and there was also free internet access. The jacuzzi was an added bonus. The staff were friendly and helpful and cleaned the room regularly. The sheets were crisp and white and spotlessly clean, I wanted to take my pillow home with me as it was SO comfortable. Further up the street was a little run down looking but there was no hassle and I never felt unsafe. The restaurants in the surrounding area (particularly the street behind this hotel) were delightfully tasty and the breakfast that came free was served in a little coffee bar in the square facing a beautiful church. The metro was a short walk as was a supermarket where the tastiest bread can be bought fresh in the morning. I would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “cold atmosphere, noisy street and in neibourhood which isn't really safe at night”
Reviews.Author: LadyMM73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very easy to find, being located very close to the main station (Roma Termini) but the street is currently a construction site, noisy and very dusty all day long. At night, it's safer to walk on a parallel, main street (Via Cavour) to get back to the hotel. The room was clean, but despite the modern design touch, it actually felt cold and sterile. I had a problem with the sink (which was clogged). Price is standard, not cheaper than accomodation of the same class, in nicer areas of Rome. They offer a kind of little breakfast tray, which is really not worth eating. It is in a convenient location for people having to catch an early morning train, but, despite the short walk till the station, I would not recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: azick1987
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night because of its location to the train station. First of all, it was a little hard to find because of all the construction going on outside the building. I had to go up a creepy old elevator to the 4th floor and barely found the "reception". The reception is not open 24 hour...actually it's not opened most of the time, so we were given a key to enter the building, the reception area, and then our room. Our room was styled very modern, but did not seem so clean..there were even stains on the comforters. The beds were HORRIBLE and you can feel the springs when you lay down. The internet that was advertised on the website was not available during our stay. Our "breakfast" consisted of a few crackers in our hotel room. The only good thing about this hotel was the man working at the reception was very friendly and helped answer all of our questions. For one night, it was bearable, but definitely not worth the money spent!

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you don't mind the noise”
Reviews.Author: nekatsiemanneercs
Reviews.Content: I am suprised so few rooms mentioned the noise. Our room was extremely noisy. The room was on the corner of the building with a tram line running directly outside and what seemed like the underground below. The windows don't do a great job blocking out the noise, nor do the shutters... the room even shakes at times. The furnishing is at end of life cycle, stains on quilt, no mattress protector etc. Use of lap top is handy but not able to print even though the gentlemen at the front desk had just printed my receipt for me. I would have paid for it. Good location for access to main rail station but poor in the overall context of rome. Quite a long and inconvenient walk to major areas of rome. It wasn't too bad but you find yourself having to spend full days out as the walk back to the room is so far. Not overly helpful front desk... was provided with a map and that was about it. The price we paid made the above bareable, but surley there must be better in Rome. I would reconsider selecting this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility, Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ArlingtonMike
Reviews.Content: I was quite pleased with WRH Suites. The staff helped me with a local points of interest (restaurants, clubs). The room was comfortable and a step up from the "Standard Square Box" one so often finds.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Ryancroes
Reviews.Content: Very nice place! It's a true hidden gem in Rome. The place is very nice and quiet! Near all main attractions in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: Martin212
Reviews.Content: WRH Suites is located on the 4th floor of a typical Roman building, close to all amenities and transportation and just a 15 minute walk from the Colosseum. The room comes with free internet access and laptop was also available. The whirlpool bath is the big plus, especially after a day of hard work. The premises are spotlessly clean and the staff are extremely polite and helpful. The price is also just fab! I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room at excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BartKummel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at WRH Suites for one week. The room was perfect. Not very large, but smart usage of space makes it spacious enough. The design interriour is very nice, as can be seen on the photos on their website. The location is excellent, just one minute walking from the Termini station, where buses and metros depart to every location in Rome. (And the express train from the airport stops here, which is very handy on arrival and department.) A laptop with internet connection is provided in the room, which turned out to be very useful to check the weather forecast and even make ticket reservations. They also offer free WiFi access if you bring your own laptop or smartphone. The cleaning of the room is good, but other maintenance can be improved, I think. There were som little defects, such as a not working lamp and some spots around the bath where the paint was damaged. Although these things do not make a stay unpleasant, I did not expect it at this price range. As stated on their website, breakfast is not included, although some biscuits are provided, as well as coffee pads that can be used in the coffee machine in the shared kitchenette. In the kitchenette are also a microwave and an electric cooking plate that can be used free of charge. Personally, I did not really miss an included breakfast. There is a good coffee shop around the corner where you can grab an Italian breakfast. (Coffee with some sweet bread, like a sweet croissant or "Cornetto". It's cheap if you eat it standing at the bar.) The reception is not manned 24 hours, but there is a list of phone numbers that can be called for emergencies. I didn't have to use that, so I cannot tell how fast the response is. During office times there is always one person present. The staff is friendly and their English is pretty good, at least for Roman standards.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here every time Im in Rome (If there's room)”
Reviews.Author: Wilson1908
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect place to stay for myself and my girlfriend on our 5 day trip to Rome. Tomaso, who was working at the desk when we arrived, took the time to give us a 20 minute breakdown of the city's sights and attractions from a locals point of view, including the main attractions deserving (and not deserving) of the hype, and as well some lesser known gems that our Lonely Planet would not have taken us to. We were completely blown away by this to start with, and the room was perfect as well. We followed his advice and had an amazing time. The rooms were tidy, modern, and provided a cool respite from the blazing summer heat. In addition, the location to city transport was ideal. The place is setup with only 4 rooms, and has the feel of a modern studio apartment more than a hotel, but that being said I would definitely book early if you know your dates. Do not be overly discouraged by the previous review, as you'll find in any major city, there can be homeless around, and some streets are less appealing than others. However, at no point in the surrounding neighborhood did we feel at all unsafe any time day or night. In response to some of the negative reviews, it must be stated that they reek of over-inflated expectations. This is not a 4 star hotel, It is a lovely, locally-focused, clean accommodation, in a great locale, for a budget price. If you want turn down chocolates on your pillow at night, expect to pay more than 100 euros. This hotel was a GREAT VALUE overall.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, quiet, nice location and great privacy in the common area”
Reviews.Author: BenDundee
Reviews.Content: Very helpfull staff, thanks Gioberto!! You can hear the bells of Maria Maggiore's Church from your bedroom, we loved it!!Good bed, clean sheets and great hydro in the shower!! The breakfast should be improved, but nice self service capuccinos!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place near Termini”
Reviews.Author: walklikeapenguin
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be near Termini on the last days of our trip so we could quickly pull the suitcases to the train station, hop on the Leonardo Express, and make the early flight for home. After coming up empty on finding accommodations every place we looked, the WRH Suites did have an opening. We booked the room and hoped for the best. Upon arrival, we learned that there was a problem. A man staying there had lost his passport and couldn't leave due to the fact that the Embassy had to use the hotel as his contact address. So they told us that we would be staying at this location for one night, but would need to move to their location on the other side of the Termini for the next night. We were disappointed that we would have to pack up and move again, but glad to help someone in need who had lost their passport. We were able to leave our suitcases at the second place in the morning, and they put them in the room after it was cleaned. In the first room, we were very relieved to find that it was clean and stylish. There was a laptop provided with internet access, a television, and a kitchen area down the hall for making coffee, etc. The only drawback here was that the bed was very close to the floor in height, giving the feeling of nearly sleeping on the floor. Anyone who may have trouble getting up from a low position might have trouble getting out of the bed. Not sure if all the beds at this location are low, however. In the second room where we stayed on the other side of Termini, the room was much larger. The bed was a normal height. Again, a laptop was provided for the internet, and there was a television and a kitchen area just outside the room door. The bathroom was bigger as well with a huge shower. The only problem we encountered here was that someone tried to enter our room with a key after I turned off the light and got in bed which caused quite a fright. I'm not sure if someone just got the wrong door or what was going on. However, I screamed and the person stopped trying the door and walked away. Although this area of the city is not where I would want to stay the whole time of my vacation, this hotel would be a good choice in order to be near Termini for departure. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are very clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice good value place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Paddieland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated a short walk to the main train station and historic sights. There also was free use of laptop with wifi. Lots of nice restuarants close by which is handy as the hotel does not have a restuarant or bar of it's own. Overall it was a good value for people just want a nice clean place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gilleke1971
Reviews.Content: Very nice room (we had room 4 - the organic room) with jacuzzi bath in the room, very large bed and nice decorations. - juices and some things to eat in the room - voucher for croissant, juice and coffee in a typical bar - nice welcome by Tomaso and excellent recommandation of very local restaurants

Reviews.Title: “It's all true!”
Reviews.Author: squirke
Reviews.Content: There's really nothing more I can add to the previous reviews - it's all true! If you want a good standard of accommodation in a quiet location but near the termini then this is perfect. Modern facilites including good shower, laptop with free broadband access and complimentary welcome snacks. It can be a little tricky to find so make sure you print out the map from the wrh website. I was a little cautious as to how the breakfast voucher would work out but the local cafe provided us with juice, smooth cappucino and a choice of a delicious pastry.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Apartement”
Reviews.Author: wakey101
Reviews.Content: We were first attracted to the apartments by the price and location, plus the fact that it had a bit of character about it. The location was spot on – a 5 minute walk from the main train and bus stations. The area isn’t classic Rome by any means, but with the stations only minutes away, the convenience with which you can travel to different areas, especially at night, makes up for it. The manager, Tomaso, was extremely helpful upon our arrival and throughout our stay. We were given a map and he proceeded to mark on the various tourist spots and bus routes. The room itself was perfect. Laptop with free internet was very handy for finding restaurants and checking information on tourist sites. The open plan bathroom is a bit of a marmite touch (love it or hate it), but we found it a nice alternative feature to the room. I would definitely recommend these apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: piekalo
Reviews.Content: We and another couple stayed at WRH Suites on a recent trip. Our friends had room 1, we had room 2. The rooms (including the bathrooms) were very clean and suited our needs perfectly. The location was excellent - several great restaurants nearby and the main train station (Termini) was within easy walking distance (even with a lot of luggage). We easily walked to all of the main attractions (Colosseum, Palantine Hill, Vatican, etc). It was also convenient to catch the double decker tour bus. The best part of staying at WRH Suites was the personal service offered by Tomaso. He was so incredibly helpful with arranging transportation for us to get from the airport to the hotel and then off to Civitavechia and back to get to our cruise ship. I can't imagine getting this type of service from a hotel chain. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, high quality”
Reviews.Author: Welshboyabroad2
Reviews.Content: Looking for a three night stay, we came across this through other reviews on Tripadvisor. They were spot on with their recommendations. This is a wonderfully located set of suites - so close to the main bus terminal and centrally positioned for those who want to explore on foot - with a charming and helpful 'receptionist' by the name of Tomaso. The room we had was upgraded and we ended up in a decent sized room with a jacuzzi and very comfortable double bed. Breakfast in a little cafe around the corner was perfect to watch morning Rome go by. All in all, a great stay and one that I would wholeheartily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “a great find in rome”
Reviews.Author: llhhbb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in July 2008. After a long search for accommodation in Rome (which we couldn't believe was so expensive) we were thrilled to find WRH Suites online. It met all our expectations upon arrival. Our room was large, bright, clean, and comfortable with the bonus of a laptop to use with free internet! We felt the room was excellent value for the price. This is not a hotel, so don't expect much contact with staff (though the contact we had was perfect and friendly) and there is not always someone at reception (but they were there at the important times, such as when we arrived, and were very helpful). The proximity to the train station is very convenient when you have luggage. It's not the nicest area in Rome but certainly came in handy when we arrived by train and then were able to take the train to the airport when leaving. I would definitely stay here again if in Rome and looking for good value accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Awsoem value for money”
Reviews.Author: Flying_Kangaroo1
Reviews.Content: An awsome find.....lovely and very friendly and helpful owners. Location great...and Termini is not that sleazy..its NO worse than any major city main rail terminal environment. The breakfast situation is good as you get to experience an italian cafe-if its raining this is a problem getting to breakfast. Its a minimal breakfast which was disappointing. The rooms could do with a paint and the floors could do with a polish. Come on WRH dont let the suites become run down you have done a wonderful job keep them looking good!! If you can book here you have done very well. Rooms large, bathrooms almost 4 star quality. AC is individual and ducted thus quiet and windows are soundproofed. 9/10!!

Reviews.Title: “Just exellent”
Reviews.Author: D_DAV
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in our trip to Europe and this stay was the highlight of all the hotels we visited. Number 1 highlight was staff being so friendly, thorough and helpful. The room was clean and well decorated and the overall experience was just fantastic. Thanks so much for a wonderful stay guys!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base to see the sights”
Reviews.Author: vicki1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights end of August. Fantastic room (junior suite) with jacuzzi bath, which was a god send after the walking we did each day! Very good location for trains, buses and metro. Would certainly stay again and recommend to friends. Breakfast included, not on site though. It was a voucher for a cafe nearby. Did have issues on second morning with cafe owner when we asked for english tea. He tried to say the voucher was only for cappucino. Did get the tea as wouldn't back down (voucher clearly states hot drink, juice and croissant).

Reviews.Title: “Great little find”
Reviews.Author: PnaiJen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel is located near the Termini (main train station) which is very convenient for sightseeing, but its not the safest & cleanest of areas. The hotel itself is on the 4th floor of a building which was undergoing construction so it was a bit dusty on the main level. The elevator was very small and cramped (just room for one and a suitcase) and I'm a bit claustrophobic, so we actually took the stairs most of the time. Tomaso at the front desk was very nice and helpful. They give you a key to the main door and your room so you have the freedom to go in and out whenever you like. We paid cash up-front - it saves you a good amount of money. We stayed in Room #1, which had a queen bed and a modern bathroom. One important thing to stress is that in this room, the shower is out in the open (not even any shower curtains!), so take note if you are staying with someone you wouldn't feel comfortable with watching you shower. On the plus side, they actually provide you with a laptop and free internet access, so that was definitely a plus. Our TV came with hundreds of channels, most of which were in foreign languages and were sexual in nature (parents beware).

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Nice Location, Fantastic Hosts”
Reviews.Author: escopazo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning and end of our 30 day Italian honeymoon tour. Coming from America the price was right! We stayed in 2 different rooms and both were clean, hip and roomy. The hosts were very gracious to hold on to a couple of big bags for us until we made it back around at the end of our trip and they were always accessible when we needed them. The location is right next to the termini and within walking distance to most of the sites on the eastern side of the city (Colosseum, Vittorio, Trevi, etc..). We hopped on the trains for anything further west and to get to the other side of the river. If you want to be in the city for a reasonable price and want access to the termini for day trips, than this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “City Apartment Feel”
Reviews.Author: TakeOffFree
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay, clean, excellent position, nice feel to the place. The apartment is about 4 stories up, 1 large room within a floor of a block of dwellings in central Rome. You have your own key, and the very nice guy allowed us to leave our bags till the end of the following day so we did not need left-luggage. You look out over a side-street, near a grocery shop, near a cathedral. Busy and lively. A good atmosphere because you are a bit like in a nest high away from the bustle. Yep ! Peter Grimshaw Berkhamsted, UK

Reviews.Title: “Cool and Friendly.”
Reviews.Author: undersea
Reviews.Content: the room was very cool (got upgraded to the larger room with the jacuzzi). It was really great and very well priced. We paid cash since that was cheaper. Very modern and with a laptop and free internet in the room. The shower was definitely cool - but it is partly exposed to the rest of the room .. so you can watch tv and chat while you shower heeheh Tomaso was very friendly and helpful with recommendations. We were very comfortable with the fact that it is more an apartment than a hotel in the sense that there is no 24 hour reception, it is in a building etc ... Actually that was a big part of why we really liked it. This seems quite common in Rome. The location is nice. Walking distance to many things. The breakfast was great for us, a croissant and a coffee to get the day started. They also leave some snacks in the room. There is also a shared kitchen if people want to buy/make their own food which makes quite a bit of sense for lunch actually. On a side note, some Rome tips: if you buy a Roma Pass make sure that it is actually VALID (mine had been already used and expired and they wouldn't take it back .. even though i bought it from the official tourist office )... and avoid putting cash in the train ticket buying machines.. use the one with a credit card option... the machine ate my 20 euros. Complaining gets you nowhere, forget customer service (except at WRH Suites where they are so nice ! hehe)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MWLGirl
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the WRH Suites (ArtHouseRome) for 3 nights in June 2008. We were seeking an affordable place to stay while touring Rome before and after a cruise and the WRH Suites proved to be an excellent choice. This is not a hotel, but 4 bedroom/bathroom suites on the 4th floor of a building near the Rome Termini Station. The location is very convenient to the train and Metro station and the bus terminal, yet a block or so beyond the more seedy area immediately next to the train station. On arrival, we were met by an employee who provided us with keys to the building, the main door to the suites, and our room. After checking in and paying (discount for cash) , he provided us with a map and took time to sit with us and give us directions and recommendations for transportation and dining. We did not see anyone at the registration desk for the remainder of our stay, but a number of "emergency" numbers were posted at the desk. Our room was nicely renovated and was spotlessly clean as was the modern (although tiny) bathroom. The air conditioning worked well and with the window closed, we did not notice street noise at all. Each room has a laptop with free internet access and a cable television. Basic toiletries are provided in the bathroom. Each day we were provided with espresso and tea packets (espresso maker in the adjacent breakfast room), packaged toast and cake, juice and bottled water. There are numerous restaurants within easy walking distance, and we felt safe in the neighborhood walking back from the Metro late at night. A tiny elevator serves the building (delightful after walking all day) and we were able to store our bags safely until our room was ready. Because this property has minimal services and is not regularly staffed, I would not recommend it to first-time travelers to Europe or travelers who prefer more luxurious hotels. However, if you are accustomed to European lodgings or B&Bs and need a clean, comfortable, safe, affordable place to sleep and shower after touring Rome all day, I highly recommend this charming place!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Junebear
Reviews.Content: My stay in this hotel was brilliant. This hotel has an excellent location to walk to all of the sights, a wonderful view of the Basillica, and is close to train station. Infact, you only have to jump on the underground and stay on until the last stop to get the airport for a tiny price compared with the cost of a taxi. The Staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful- I booked to stay in the double, but due to a booking mix up was put in the suite (with jacuzzi bath!) for not extra cost. Hotel was wonderfully decorated, there was a flat screen tv and laptop with free internet in the room. The price was brilliant- perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: juliemccoy1
Reviews.Content: Leaned of WHR Suites from Hotel Cestelli in Florence. The location is fantastic, and the staff is more than helpful and accomodating. I will always check availability here first when travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Review of customer service”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: Note: I did not stay at the property. However, I booked via TripAdvisor/booking.com on a late Thursday night for a Saturday arrival after reading these reviews. I received confirmation of the reservation. On Friday morning, I received a personal note from Tomaso saying that due to the small property and not so great IT integration with reservation systems, they had double booked rooms and would not be able to accomodate me. He was very apologetic and offered a discount to another WRH property nearby. I did not immediately reply and a few hours later Tomaso called as well. While disappointed not to be able to stay, I was impressed by the personal touch and care. Advice: If you want to stay at this property, allow a few advance days if booking electronically and have a back-up plan OR simply call Tomaso, very friendly and eager to accomodate your visit.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant termini”
Reviews.Author: julesfin2008
Reviews.Content: We would totally recommend the WHR Suite at Termini, Rome. It is incredibly well placed, close to the station and within walking distance of most things. This is how all hotels should be run. Reasonably priced, a no frills, fresh attitude and basic simplicity. The staff were very friendly, the rooms light and clean and the intimate scale of the place certainly added to a very pleasant escape. We spent 4 nights here but unfortunately and had to relocate for our final night, our experience at the alternative hotel was less positive in all respects. I hope to consider WHR on future trips and hope that other hotels can learn from the model.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway in a Design Environment”
Reviews.Author: DidCha
Reviews.Content: Hi, We just got back from a 3day - 2night stay in Rome at the Arthouse (WRH Suites). It is just a great place - the location is very convenient, the hospitality of the owners is great - from the moment of making the reservation, all the way till saying goodbye. They gave us great advice on where to eat (great food at local, roman places), on what to visit (and avoid the queues) and in general on getting around in Rome. We were lucky after one night to get an upgrade to the junior suite, which is a great room for a romantic getaway - imagine drinking baileys in a jacuzzi-bath and listening to music (or if you really want watching a movie on the flatscreen tv). If we would go again - we would definitely go for the suite (worth the extra money). Are there maybe some small downsides? Of course, nothing is perfect (not even in Italy) like the fact of getting breakfast in another cafe or the minibar with no ice for our baileys, the huge selection of satellite channels that gets confusing, but all makes it even better of getting us out of the hotel to explore wonderful Rome. In short - a great place to stay - Thanks Tomaso for the great advise and we hope to be back. Tanya & Didier

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service, optimal location”
Reviews.Author: Dickvr
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel very much. Thank you to Tomaso and his colleagues for the close attention to our well-being. We got great recommendations from them for places to eat out, where to go and when/how to get there. The WRH Suites only has four rooms, staff is around only at times that you (may) need them and breakfast is served at a nearby coffee-place. Location nearby Termini is great, only a few minutes walk and close to all the touristic sites. The place is clean, friendly and hip looking.

Reviews.Title: “A Brillant Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Braz01
Reviews.Content: We (my brother and I) went to Rome for a short break and booked this hotel (It had an exclusive feel with only 4 rooms) but that said, it was everything the other reviews said it was, friendly staff, good location (close to the termini train station) but easily within walking distance of all the sites...or the metro for those a little out of the way. The rooms were modern and always clean, neat and tidy, although we didn't spend much time in them...Would recommend this to anyone looking for a great stay in Rome. Just a small note, just keep an eye out for the door sign as looks like a regular apartment entrance. Cheers again.

Reviews.Title: “One word..FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: kitxxxx
Reviews.Content: Had a great start to a 3 week European vacation! This review will be short and sweet. 1) Hotel was at a fantastic location..walkable to most attractions and shopping as well! 2) Room was great..bathroom was fantastic too! Great shower! 3) Last but not least..Tomaso is the BEST! One bad thing though..unless you really looked closely..you're gonna miss the hotel! There's only a tiny little sign with WRH on it! This is minor though, the hotel's good points way outweigh this little thing. All in all, a great stay! Thanks again Tomaso!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BreadbakerWA
Reviews.Content: I think I knew I had made the right choice in Rome even before we arrived. Within three minutes of receiving confirmation of my booking, I received an email from Tomaso asking me relevant questions and giving me advice on arrival. When I replied, I got another, more personalized reply within a few minutes as well. The hotel is located two blocks from the Termini train station in central Rome. It's easily walkable from the station, and the walk, with all our luggage felt quite safe on a sunny afternoon. There is a button outside with the name of the hotel on it, and when we pressed it we were delighted to hear Tomaso ask for us by name. When you have only four rooms, you know who is likely to press the bell. We made it up the rickety elevator and the room was not ready (as we had been warned it would not be). But instead of being told to drop our luggage and come back, Tomaso took us to the breakfast room, gave us great Italian coffee and cookies, and sat us down with a map of Rome. He showed us all the sites we would want to see, drew the bus lines and Metro lines we would want to take to get there. Then he drew little boxes for recommended restaurants, with descriptions of each and when we would be likely want to go there. His restaurant recommendations (except one was closed for lunch on Sunday so were on our own) proved to be excellent; we had great Roman pasta and perfect pizza at reasonable prices. But his best recommendation was this, "Get lost in Rome." With his map, and a little bump of geography, he suggested we could have no better time than to wander streets aimlessly. Again, he was right. The room was small but functional. The wireless internet worked perfectly (and there is a laptop if you don't have one). The refrigerator was great to have, and the free and endless snacks and coffee and juice were wonderful. The bed was fine, the bathroom small but fine, and the view across the street was "typical Rome." They were remodelling the building and the way the door opens is a little weird, but all in all we could not have had a better experience in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “nice spot to stay”
Reviews.Author: chipsambos
Reviews.Content: Close to Termini train station. Staff very friendly and helpful - esp. Tomas! Rooms kept nice and clean. Laptop with the internet access in room is dead handy. Would stay again and have recommended to others.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice and different”
Reviews.Author: henrymatisse
Reviews.Content: After looking through the website for fair priced hotels in Rome and finding only small rooms with terrible interiors I was delighted with the looks of this hotel. Only four rooms but designed in the modernist fashion with a Le Courbisier room etc. On the fourth floor in a typical Rome apartmenthouse. A small desk just inside the entrance door with the best service you could imagine. Helpful and timetaking. No fuzz with charging extra for all the small things. When in Rome, you will have a nice stay here. It is close to the Rome Termini so it is easy to reach from the Fiumicino airport (a 11€ trip) Mats Andersson

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Shawnilyn
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Arthouse. Even though the exterior was undergoing some work as other reviews have noted, we could care less about that. (as a side note, they are expecting it to be completed soon.) However, none of it mattered when we were inside the apartment. The rooms are very modern in design, just like what they show you on their website. We loved them and found them to be very clean! Our bathroom was spotless and everything felt very sanitary. As far as the service goes, when we arrived, "Tomaso" greeted us and sat down with us to get us oriented with the city by writing on a map some of the important sights as well as some of the restaurants that he personally recommends and goes to himself. He told us how to take the subway or bus to the places further away, and marked all this on the map in relation to the hotel. He gave us his phone # as well as some other #s of people that also help run the apartment, in case we needed anything beyond the hours that he would be present at the front desk. (He informed us ahead of time too exactly when someone would be there) We liked having our own key to the apartment to come and go as we pleased. We found we didn't need assistance beyond the breakfast hours. Speaking of breakfast, we enjoyed the freshly made cappucinos. So perfect!! He shared with us his way of frothing the milk and it made us determined to go home and work on our own technique. There was fruit, toast, ham, cheese, rolls, and danishes, also juice and bottled water. We walked to everything, the colleseum, spanish steps, pantheon, etc. We were happy to burn off all the pasta we ate!! We didn't feel unsafe near the Termini station, and just tried to blend in and not show uncertainty or fear. But we stayed alert, nonetheless, having been warned by travel books, travellers, and even this site, we tried to know where we were going before we left the apartment, and if we got lost, discreetly checked our map to get our bearings. We would definatly stay here again when travelling to Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, large room - pity about the renovations”
Reviews.Author: SCS62
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this 4 room B&B for 3 nights in Sept 07. The proximity to the rail station and many economical restaurants was ideal. Unfortunately the building in which it is housed was covered in scaffolding both outside and in the stair/lift well with dust, dirty wind blown plastic sheeting and building materials in abundance. On arrival we were informed that we had been upgraded to a superior room at no charge. Now this sounded good but there was to be a catch: this so-called superior room had a jacuzzi that did not work and the TV had broken down the night before and had not yet been fixed. On being advised of this we requested that we be placed in the room we originally booked but were told it was already occupied but we could have it for the next 2 nights. The next day we were told the TV had been fixed and we chose to stay in the upgraded room. We voiced our dissatisfaction with the room situation and the state of the building and requested financial consideration. We were pleasantly surprised the following evening when we returned to a substantial cash refund and bottle of wine. Pls don't let this put you off WRH as the building works are apparently planned to be completed soon. The rate was good for Rome, the room was modern, clean & large by European standards and well appointed including a laptop with free internet access. The staff were friendly and responded as best they could given the circumstances - thanks Thomaso!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: WI_Traveler2007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there on our honeymoon for two nights. Yes the staff was not around all the time but they where there when ever we needed. Their breakfast was simple but satisfying always with fresh toast and hot coffee. The laptop and internet where a nice touch. The room was clean and had very high ceilings which was nice. The hotel just 2 blocks from the train station was a great, but we still walked most places. I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: gerKoln
Reviews.Content: Rooms very small, poor breakfast, not very clean, very noisy Good location, personal very nice

Reviews.Title: “Great Tiny Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PlateMan
Reviews.Content: WRH Suites is a great place to stay in Rome. The hotel as they state is tiny, as it only has four rooms. The staff is friendly and happy to help when they are there. They make it known that the front desk is not staffed all the time and they were not there alot, however mobiles are provided in case of emergency. The room itself was amazing. A nice large room (I was upgraded to a junior suite) that has the laptop with free internet and a great open plan bath. One thing to note is that you must use their laptop as they could not give me the passwords for my personal laptop. Location is great for the railway station which allows access to all of Rome. Breakfast was small but the attendant makes hot drinks and is happy to take care. One thing to note that upon my visit (late July 2007) the entire building is under construction so scaffolding surrounds the windows and you walk into what looks a war zone. Once you enter the hotel everything is fine. You have your own key for easy access. This place is a great find and definitely worth a visit while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great value”
Reviews.Author: louisemcauley
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice room - nice modern design and very clean. Breakfast was good - continental breakfast. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Having been to room about 7 or 8 times, we found the accomodation good value for money (in Rome)

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: PirateLola
Reviews.Content: Great location to Termini, just a few mins walk from the main entrance. Staff very helpful and friendly. Our room was very spacious and modern in design. The flat screen TV and free internet access were fantastic extras. The internet especially as we could look up things to do etc while we were there. The only down side is the area it's in. We stayed in November and the evenings got dark quickly. It seemed there were a few shady bars and a lot of people hanging around on corners at dusk. For this reason I would say just be vigilant when returning to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff but some problems”
Reviews.Author: jo219
Reviews.Content: Saw some great reviews on these rooms so decided to stay for a 40th birthday weekend with brother and sister-in law. May is a very expensive time in Rome and these seemed the best value. On arrival, however, we were a little disappointed as we had not been informed that the whole building was to be covered in scaffolding and we were unable to open any window let alone look at the view from our room which is advertised on the website. After a fantastic first day in Rome we returned to our room to find that they had been deadlocked by the cleaner on her first day in the job and we had to try to get hold of some one to let us in which took 1.5 hrs!!! Oh and don't pay for the junior suite as the whirlpool bath doen't work!! Obviously some of this was just one of those things and the rooms were nicely decorated, clean and the staff (except the cleaner which we never saw again!) were exceptionally helpful, Thomasso is lovely and we did get a reasonable discount for the inconvenience so we can't complain too much. Rome is fantastic but very busy at this time of year. Don't bother trying to get into the Vatican museum or St. Peters the queue was literally a mile or more long!!! Apparently you can preorganise a tour with the vatican for a fee and then you will be let in at a set time but we only found that out after!! We would stay here again as the location and value (relatively - Rome is expensive) was good and we would definitely come back to Rome though may be at a quieter timeof year.

Reviews.Title: “Let down, possibly expected too much”
Reviews.Author: jwhflorida
Reviews.Content: I had read the recent reviews (Jan-Apr 07). None mentioned the lack luster performance of the AC. I suspect it is just blowing warm air because the room has not cooled down after an hour of running the system. If your traveling with someone sensitive about temperature/humidity at night you might need to look elsewhere. I got this room to be near the train station prior to departure. And because most of the reviews spoke well of the interior and staff assistance. In hind sight, I would have preffered to stay at a better hotel (one where the AC worked) and just planned to take a taxi cab ride to the station. I was given a taxi cab ride from Ponte Sisto Bridge to the Roma Termini last week-end that just took 10 minutes (around 7:30 am) and cost 10 euros.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: monchienstupide
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in Rome and our room in this small hotel very well located. The decoration was great and design. In my opinion, two sings have to be improved : the breakfast is a litlle cheap and poor (please give us real orange juice) and there was very litlle water pressure in the shower. Nevertheless, we would'nt hesitate to recommand this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “A Daimond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: District2LA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently went on our Honeymoon to Italia. We stayed at three inns in three different cities. This one was the most unique of the lot. For the price we paid, I must say that the amenities were fantastic! We were provided with Internet access, and a laptop computer, in the room. In addition, there was a flat screen television, with a wide array of channels provided via satellite service (not that we spent a great deal of time watching the telley, but still, it was nice). The bed was enormous and comfortable (a must after a day of non-stop walking around any city in Italia). Moreover, I must compliment the staff at this remarkable inn for being extremely courteous, knowledgeable, and flexible. The proximity to the train station was extremely helpful as well. My wife and I arrived at Termini Station very late in the evening, and were delighted to discover that we only had to walk approximately 3 blocks with our luggage. Finally I would like to thank the owner (I believe he was the owner) for providing us with invaluable advice, and assistance while in Rome. Our flight back to The United States departed early in the morning, and the owner arranged for us reliable and comfortable transportation to the Airport at 4 in the morning. Also if you visit this lovely establishment, be sure to try the suggestions the owner offers for eating out, both restaurants were remarkable, and off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KaiHerz
Reviews.Content: The WRH Suites is a great place to stay when visting Rome. The staff is very friendly and helping out on anything the guest needs. The breakfast is good for a good morning start. The only thing to remember is that the WRH Suites is located near Termini railway station (which is good from an arrival and departure perspective around luggage transportation). While doing sightseeing it takes a 10-15 minute footwalk to the City Centre (Pantheon), so better take the tube or bus lines (however latter are hard to identify where they are going to). Really can recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great find and value”
Reviews.Author: havebabywilltravel
Reviews.Content: Clean, well decorated room. Comfortable bed. The very helpful staff helped us find a hotel at our next destination and recommended great places to eat. Everyone was very nice to our 17 month old son and made us feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little place!”
Reviews.Author: Cartytree
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at WRH Suites and found it a great place to stay. It is very close to Termini station which is ideal when catching the train from the airport and for catching the metro when your legs get tired! The suites are modern and very clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. The in- room laptop was a great touch. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the outside put you off”
Reviews.Author: troybadoo
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here in room number 2. Facilities are excellent, staff especially Franco could not be more helpful. The room was very modern (warning bath is in the room) with red, black and white theme. The complimentary laptop with free internet was a wonderful touch. The plasma screen tv had literally hundreds of stations with plenty in English. It is ideally located 5mins walk from Centrum. The outside looks terrible, and the way up to the 4th floor also is terrible, however it is not their building so there is not much they can do about that. A police station is located on the corner, so even though it is in a built up area near the station we didn't think twice about walking at night around the area. Rome is beautiful and you could do a lot worse than have WRH as your base.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little place”
Reviews.Author: monkeyzoo
Reviews.Content: A great little place. It is the 4th floor of an apartment block – (there’s an internet café place on the ground floor which makes it easier to find as it would be easy to walk past). There seems to be some re-wiring going on in the building so there is a lot of mess, but inside WRH is a very clean & peaceful haven! It is very close to Termini station but just far enough away to be out of the dodgy areas. Great restaurants nearby and a couple of pubs – particularly loved ‘The Fiddler’s Elbow’ for a beer or two and Tudini’s and Scolio Di Frisse were great for food. It is also ideally placed for walking to the main sites, but if you were getting the metro/bus, Termini is the place to catch them from. Just opposite the hotel is a little market shop that sells wine, fruit, chocolate etc so very handy. The rooms were spotless and were really, really well cleaned each day. The bed was ENORMOUS and very comfortable. The in-room safe was pretty nifty too. The hydrobath was FANTASTIC and an absolute joy at the end of the day. (Seriously, wear the comfiest shoes you have as Rome’s streets are a bit wobbly). The shower could be a little sporadic, but if you gave it a few minutes it got going. Hot water doesn’t seem to be on all day either, though it is on in the am & pm when you really need it. The laptop with free internet access were a godsend and very useful for sending emails home and uploading photo’s at the end of the day. The breakfast was only small (toast, cereal, ham, cheese) but enough to keep you going ‘till lunchtime. And the coffee/tea was freshly made and gorgeous! The staff were always helpful and friendly. Particular mention must go to Tomaso who was absolutely fantastic – a genuinely warm & decent chap! Yes, the entrance was noisy and soundproofing of other rooms wasn’t so great (I could hear another guest blowing their nose in their room while I was in the breakfast room!). However, the windows were well insulated and you could rarely hear outside street noise. All in all a great place that I have already recommended to friends & family. It’s a lovely, clean, friendly and intimate place and we will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Very highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: kat&jimbo
Reviews.Content: This is a brilliant hotel. The rooms are lovely and the staff are very helpful. We were a little concerned about the location after reading reviews on this site, but it is absolutely fine, and a great place from which to explore rome. Breakfast wasn't brilliant but wasn't bad either. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hidden Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: Kevinyippy
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at the WRH Suites in Rome, and would strongly recommend this place to anyone looking for a classy, convenient, cosy, friendly and spcaious room in Rome. The serviced apartments are tastefully designed, feature Philip Starck designed furniture and most importantly the service staff: Franco, Tomaso and Alba are extremely friendly and helpful. They were the receptionist, concierge, chef and room service all at the same time. The location of the suites is literally 3 minutes from the Termini station. As Italy has 2 Metro lines which cross only at Termini, being at Termini was really convenient for us to access the sights around the city. My wife and I also uncovered a simple restaurant just 3 doors away called Restaurant Santi, owned and operated by an elderly gentleman called Santi and his wife. The food was very good, generous portions and the price was really affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowGroom
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the WRH Suites in Rome for 5 nights on our honeymoon. Overall, we were very happy with the accomodation, which is one block back from the road into town and near, but not next to, the train station. The breakfast was a bit basic - one-serving cartons of orange juice, packets of sliced meat, packets of toast and cheese, and fruit - but the coffee was good. We weren't too happy that we weren't told that noisy construction work was beginning in the building. The location was good for the bus/train station, and the owners were able to recommend very good local restaurants - Suburra being superb and very reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel near the train station”
Reviews.Author: Uccella
Reviews.Content: This is a great budget option near the train station (that doesn't feel like a budget hotel at all). We stayed here for four nights during our honeymoon. The rooms are clean and modern, the staff is very helpful (especially Tomaso at the front desk!), and the location is just close enough to the train station to be convenient, but not so close that you feel unsafe. There's also a laptop with internet access in each room, which is especially convenient for making reservations, checking flight arrival times, etc.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL GREAT VALUE!!!”
Reviews.Author: voyagean
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling to Rome and thinking of staying in this hotel DO NOT HESITATE!!! I went with my mother in a 20-day trip trough Italy and this was the last and best hotel of our trip. If you arrive by train is great that you can get to the property in 5 minutes walking. The hotel is in one floor of an old building, so don´t feel dissappointed by the exterior... once you are up there everything is shiny and new!!! The welcome by Franco was warm and friendly (something unussual in Italy!!) and once we got into our 2-bed room we were surprised by the excellent size and design of the room. The bathroom is superb and modern and the great touches as the flat satellite tv and computer with free internet access are incredible. When I booked this hotel trough their website I was afraid that maybe it will be too modern for my mother but she just loved it!!! Trust me everithing is as nice as it looks in the website Breakfast is fine, with cold cuts, yoghurt, juice, fruit and bread and the nice breakfast lady will prepare toast and capuccino for you. Breakfast room is also modern and bright. Right now this is a GREAT value in Rome in terms of what you pay and what you receive, wich is an axcellent retreat in a beautiful but chaotic city. Believe me, you will hardly be in your hotel room but, at the end of the day it's always great to come back to a wonderful place to rest. GO NOW before they raise their rates!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Modern Decor, Clean, at Affordable Rates”
Reviews.Author: Gansa
Reviews.Content: The guy that gave this place a bad review must have stayed somewhere else, because this place is truly great. Only four rooms, recently renovated with stylish modern design. Impeccably clean, with a laptop computer with free Internet access, LCD TV, sound system and a safe. Our room, No.4 (the same as the guy with the poor review) was large and very comfortable. The sound-proof windows are really sound-proof and you completely forget that you are 3 blocks away from the Termini (didn't notice there was a construction nearby). You do get some noise from the hallway, but its minimal and only in the morning. One very important thing to be aware of for non-couples traveling together, is that the shower/jacuzzi is basically in the room and has clear glass, so unless you are traveling as a couple, that aspect may be uncomfortable. Not sure if the other 3 rooms are like that, but I recommend that you ask beforehand. Otherwise, it’s very romantic! The staff is fantastic and very respectful, especially Tomaso. He was extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast is simple, but adequate. Although not located in the fanciest part of Rome, it is very conveniently located, nearby the Termini, 2 blocks away from Santa Maria Maggiore and a very pleasant 20 minute walk to the Colosseo. No problems walking to and from the Termini at night. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish + Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: *MissBlondie20*
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutley fantastic. The rooms are just how they look on the WRH website, maybe even better. It is only a small hotel which gives it a nice personal touch. I would definitely recommend WRH Suites to anyone thinking of staying in Rome. Probably not suitable for those that want to be right in the heart of the city as it a bit of a walk into the very centre, but the plus side to that is that you see more of Rome! Friendly staff make your stay even more enjoyable! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere else in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: autobiztravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the most unscrupulous property I have ever stayed at. They misrepresented so many aspects it was hard to believe. The 2 bed room we booked was actually one bed with a fold up, bed hidden from the view of the pictures, the second bed is intended only for a child...never mentioned. Our first night was totally sleepless, as the "sound proofed" windows were no match for all night construction outside the building. Ear plugs were necesary just to sleep. Our complaints of this fact were met with indifference and disrespect...that is once someone showed up the next day. Breakfast is supposed to start at 7am, but there was no one present until 7:45 by which time we already needed to be in line at the Vatican. Again NO apology, and certainly no offer to make amends. The room was dingy, with mold all around the edges of the tub, the desk person showed up the 2nd day unshaven, and unshowed wearing a profane T-shirt that said (---) fashion. Complete last of professionalism, and even common courtesy for their guests’ sensitivities. I finally told them I would only pay 400 euros for the stay, which they begrudgingly accepted. Then in a complete disregard to ethics, they charged the balance of 140 euros on my credit card. DO NOT trust this establishment with your credit card number.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: JNLTravel
Reviews.Content: We are a couple from NYC in our very late 20's and like many others who have reviewed this establishment, my wife and I were apprehensive about the location, but are very pleased that we decided to stay here. WRH Suites is located just two blocks from Termini which some would consider a downfall, but we did not have a problem with this. Yes there are shady characters around the station but that is the case in any major transportation hub around the world. This hotel was also walking distance to the major attractions (not short walks) but walking nonetheless. The staff was extremely helpful to recommend a nice place to stay and even with setting up a day trip to Pompeii. I have read complaints about the breakfast, but we found it to be adequate and sufficient. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad.”
Reviews.Author: Sedonabound
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived in Italy, we got a call from the WRH letting us know that reception closes at 6pm and if we did not arrive before then, we would be unable to check-in. Since we were traveling through tuscany before arriving in Rome, we were slightly miffed that we now had to rearrange our plans to get to Rome earlier (we did NOT know there was no overnight reception). We ended up arriving in Rome closer to 7, and the man that called us was still there to let us in (thank goodness). The hotel is in a slightly shady neighborhood just a block or two from the station terminal. Here's what's good: there was a computer with free internet in our room and digital cable. The decor was nice (though there was a stain on our comforter), and the bathroom was cool, even if the drain did not really drain very well. The staff (which consisted of one guy our whole three day stay) was nice enough, though certainly not overly friendly. I suppose with this hotel you get what you pay for. I would not stay here again, mainly because I did not feel 100% safe with the location. If you're on a budget, it's not a bad place, but you can probably do better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, recommend it to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: wendy1405
