Reviews.Content: me and my husband stayed at this hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary for three days, we loved it. the website pictures are a true representation of the rooms and the staff there are amazing. upon arrival tomaso showed us a map with the best places to go and some excellent restuarants. all of the staff at the wrh went out of there way to help you. after reading some of these reviews i was alittle apprehensive as to its location and whether it would be difficult to find, we left termini station and it is just a very short walk away on the left hand corner, the sign is very small but we found it no problem and the area around the hotel, okay its not the best area but i felt safe at night. everything is in walking distance the only thing we used public transport for was the vatican. the hotel is very modern and extremely clean, the lady who serves breakfast is wonderful and so nice, i just popped out every morning as she made toast and coffee and took it to our room. i have to say that this was definatly a wonderful hotel and i would recommend it to anyone. we will definatly go back, we had a wonderful time and i'm sad to be home!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the decor!!!!”
Reviews.Author: anile
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome where we stayed at WRH suites. I stayed there with my husband for three nights and we loved the place and of course the people there that were very helpful. The fact that they all spoke english was an advantage since nearly noone in italy speaks english and it is hard to find your way around. Tomaso guided us to some interesting sights and restaurants. The room was better than we expected and the decoration just great. It is exactly where you need to return after a tiring day of sightseing and shopping in Rome!!! Free internet proved to be extremely helpful, as well. Despite the area around the hotel, that is a bit scary at night, we would definately stay there again and recomment it to all our friends planning a trip to Rome!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this unique & modern B&B!!!”
Reviews.Author: miller931
Reviews.Content: We stayed at WRH Suites for 3 nights at the end of our month long trip. Everything was perfect! We would definitely stay there again if we go back to Rome. Their photos on the website are very representative of the actual place, no surprise at all. We love the modern decor and the helpful host who gave us very good restaurant suggestions. Highly recommended!!! This is the place I would send my family and friends if they visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great modern private apartment”
Reviews.Author: BADBOYT
Reviews.Content: Wellcome to WRH suites Rome!....... My son and I stayed four day's in the WRH Suites private apartments. One block from the Train station great location since we all have luggage. It wasa great stay. The staff is on call 24/7 and allways in the office every morning to help you get to your tours or let you get your rest as you will need it from walking the streets of Roma! More, the rooms are modern the bed was very comfortable but could be softer, there is internet service a great flat screen TV and city maps available on check-in they have a small refrigerator in the room but will up-grade to a larger one so you can freeze some of your perishables. I just used the kitchen as my own every morning to freeze some water for the hot summer days. Tomaso and his staff are great I really liked talking with the morning help as she was very intelligent served a great breakfeast and I had a great conversation with her say hello for me! Really the only problem I had was the MOTO GP was not available during my evening stay but that was OK! I also hear they are about to open another Bed and Breakfeast hope to stay there also! I rate this Suite/Apartment Five Stars *****

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Cheeseburger397
Reviews.Content: An exclusive and unique design accomodation-hip and chic. We stay at the WRH suites for 5 nights and we enjoyed it very much. The place was very modern and clean with air-condition. The actual suite is better than the pictures with contemporary concepts and high ceiling. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Thanks again, Tomaso (who direct us to all the sight-seeing points in Rome and good restaurants) and Alba (who take care of our breakfast every morning). The free internet in-room service with laptop provided was an excellent bonus! Location is great - it is just a few minutes walk from Rome Termini on a quiet side street. I would definitely recommend the WRH Suites to anyone who would like to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Rome”
Reviews.Author: SamiSeppala
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed this place between 5th and 7th of July and it was very nice place. We are a couple of 36-44 and liked the modernism of this place. Everything was clean and almost new. There was also free use of pc in the room, thing that you don`t often see even at 5 stars hotels. Satellite tv with lot of channels also included as did minibar. Breakfast was little, but more than we expected. All and all , well worth the money they ask for a night or two stay in Rome. Extra plus goes for the situation of the place, its just 100m. from Roma Termini station so it is easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: rockymountain
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three nights in May in the Junior Suite. We did not care for the area of town, as it was not exactly the nicest neighborhood, and not that close for walking to the main attractions. The room looked like it needed renovations, and the breakfast was only cappucino and a bit of cereal. The TV channels did not work. I guess most reviewers really liked this place, but it certainly was not for us.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the WRH Suite for 3 nights and thought that the overall stay was very good. Do not be put off by the exterior of the building as once you are in the actual hotel the overall mood is welcoming, relaxed and the fact that there are only 4 rooms means that you get that personal touch. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and provided a map and advice on where to go and how to get there. The only minor drawback is that staff leave in the afternoon and therefore if you have any questions or need anything you have to call them....thankfully we didn't have to do that. The rooms were modern and clean and provided a relaxing getaway from a busy day out in rome. Location is good with many bars and restaurants nearby. You can also walk to pretty much any of the main sights but the main station is also close if you feel lazy. Breakfast is basic and OK but it provides a good start to a busy day. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the WRH Suites and would recommend it to anybody who wants a modern, relaxing and friendly alternative to the mainstream style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You never expect the reviews on the web to be true, but it was really awesome. We had a huge room, great facilities.. The place is hard to find, but once you have that figured out it is a little oasis. You can walk from the Termini to, it isn't that far at all. Everyone is really polite and love to us. Highly recommend WRH Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Your Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGuest
Reviews.Content: We booked the WRH Suite Hotel based on research and TripAdvisor recommendations and it was the best hotel of our two week stay in Italy. The rooms are nicely furnished in modern contemporary style with very clean modern bathrooms. The staff are cheerful and friendly, especially Alba who greeting us at every breakfast in the morning with a smile. The hotel was quiet and peaceful which made it relaxing when you are back from a long day of sightseeing. If you want to stay out of the mainstream in a small guest house in the center of Rome this would be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The WRH Suites in Rome is an excellent hotel. The staff are very personable and friendly. It is nice that there are only four Suites in the hotel so you have a sense of privacy and personal attention. I would highly reccomend this hotel to any couple or business traveler who need a few days stay in Rome. The only drawbacks that we experienced was the shower seemed to lack water pressure, which made showering a bit tedious and the occasional noise out in the main lobby during the nights. However, this is mainly expected at every hotel and we really did not notice this more than a slight annoyance. So, if you are looking for an excellent place with over the top service and attention to detail, for an affordable rate, these suites are for you.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Rome Termini”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The ArtHouse Hotel -- actually 4 or 5 rooms on the 4th floor (small elevator) -- is only about a block from Rome Termini if you need that kind of convenience. Seems this neighborhood is less touristy despite its proximity to the train station. The rooms are done in stark modern. They are clean and have sound dampening shutters to close out street noise which is considerable. But, there's air conditioning on warm nights. Breakfast was adequate, packaged toast, cheeses, prosciutto, and yogurt with freshly made coffee. A real plus is free fast internet access on their laptop computers in each room. They also have cable tv.

Reviews.Title: “Great, unusual hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A great welcome at this unusual hotel. We were allowed into our room earlier than we had expected. We were given a map, had some nearby sites pointed out and a couple of restaurant recommendations from Tomaso. Room was unusual in that the jacuzzi bath is actually in the room. Not a major problem for us, but some people might find it awkward. Tomaso, Franco, Alba and Miriam were all very professional and friendly. Having a key to the building made us feel like real Romans. If you're looking for something different in a hotel, this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and central!”
Reviews.Author: lizinleesburg
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this B&B based on tripadvisor reviews. We usually stay at more mainstream hotels, and were initially doubtful about our choice upon arrival - small elevator that fit one at a time with luggage, and not a very welcoming entry to the building. BUT, it was the best place we stayed on our trip to Italy. Very central - especially in location to the train station. Decent restaurants for a quick meal nearby. Very clean and quiet. Felt safe and the in-room laptop was a welcome addition. I'm not usually a fan of modern decor - but thought it was very comfortable. The morning breakfast was enough for me and the woman serving was very pleasant. I wish we had taken more advantage of the staff's offer to help plan your visit. I would recommend this hotel - although, not to those who strongly prefer a more traditional hotel and one in the middle of all of the action.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay Deminished by the Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bedford Rob
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at this B&B for the last week in March. I had a conference just outside Rome and had picked the ArtHouseRome due to its proximity to the train station and the reviews from TripAdvisor[""]. The hotels close proximity to the train station made transport to and from the city centre very convienient.The room was excellent: clean, modern, with high-speed internet connectivity and while close to the train station was quite quiet. My wife explored Rome for the 5 days I was in meetings, she had some questions about the area and the staff, for the most part, was helpful except for Tomaso. He was quite simply rude. I would normally not stay at this B&B due to the cost, my work was paying for the stay and this was quite reasonable for a hotel in downtown Rome. We normally stay at budget hotels and had stayed in some Convents while travelling in Italy. These budget accommodations may lack the ammenities of the higher priced hotels & B&Bs but for personal travel the convents provide an excellent alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Funky”
Reviews.Author: Dragonred
Reviews.Content: We picked WRH for our recent three night stay in Rome after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, checking our their website and getting a decent price. It's a very different hotel with funkily designed rooms. I'd stay there again. A friend of ours who's stayed at the Intercontinental in Rome visited us here and preferred it to her hotel. The hotel itself is located on a floor of an old building and has 4 bedrooms and a common area for kitchen/dining. There's a person who's available in the mornings. If you are arriving late, you need to inform them in advance so they wait for you. Location: Literally, a 5 minute walk from the main entrance to the train station. Make sure you exit from the correct/main entrance. The train from the airport will drop you at the secondary entrance. Almost everything that's to see within Rome is 20 minutes walk from the hotel. There are a number of small cafes, internet and laundry joints scattered around the hotel. There are other B&Bs in the same location. Some, within the same building. Physical upkeep: The building is old, the stairs and the walls leading to the hotel are a little run-down but clean. The hotel itself has been recently renovated with top of the line furnishings and bathroom fittings. It's clean, very well kept, and has quite a modern design. The design is what distinguishes the hotel from other B&Bs. Room size & amenties: The rooms are clean, spacious, with a flat screen TV and a wi-fi laptop provided free to charge. There's an internet cafe right below the hotel. So, the free laptop with wi-fi may not be that valuable an amenity as you'd think it would be. Breakfast is adequate comprising of prepacked bread, croissants, biscuits, fruits, yogurt and freshly made coffee. Bottomline: The location is great. And if you can't get anything decent for the price quoted by this hotel, go for this one. it's truly different. You will not mind coming back at night to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great concept, but a few downsides”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Whenever we travel, we always try to find hotels with a twist, i.e. with a special decorative theme, or with special ammenities (pool, etc.). We picked the WRH Suites for several reasons: 1) There were only 4 rooms 2) We had never been to Rome, and we felt that its location would allow us to access easily the various sites we wanted to see 3) The decoration of the room seemed very original, unique, and luxurious 4) The price was decent When we booked the room (a few months in advance), we specifically mentionned that we wanted the room which had the double bed (and not the two single beds). Upon arrival, we were told that they could not give us the room we had asked, because otherwise the other room (the one we were given) would have been empty for too many days, or some excuse of the sort. The room we got had two single beds which they pushed together. It was dissapointing, especially since the decoration was not the one we were hoping for. But in any case, it was still a nice room, whith a gorgeous bathroom, and a very convenient laptop computer which allows you to go online. It was particularly useful when we wanted to browse and find restaurant or shop addresses. A definite plus!!! The service was nice. The people at the desk are pleasant and are willing to give you directions or organize reservations, etc. for you if you need them to. You're given a key to the hotel because after a certain time in the afternoon, there's no one at the desk. We didn't mind this, but some people might find it inconvenient not to have someone who's available at all times of the day and night. Breakfast is served in a two-table room, and you've got a choice of croissants, cereal, coffee, tea, etc. It's not a huge breakfast, but it's enough. The biggest negative point of our trip, in addition to the room not being the one we wanted, was when we left. Our plane was at 7pm, but we had to check out before noon, which is normal. We asked if we could leave our luggage until the middle of the afternoon, but the guy at the desk told us that it was his day off, and that he had only come to make us check out. I asked if we could keep the keys and leave them in the mail box, but he told us that that wasn't possible either. So we had to go to the train station, and wait in line nearly two hours to deposit our luggage. We didn't do much on our last day in Rome, because we had already wasted so much time with the luggage, and then we were scared it would take us as long to be able to get it back, so we got to the train station really early so as not to miss the bus... and then our plane! All in all a pleasant stay, but the fact that it's such a small hotel with a limited number of staff definetly has its downsides.

Reviews.Title: “nice and elegant”
Reviews.Author: YigalM
Reviews.Content: We reserved a place in this hotel after reading the reviews in this site, and indeed were not disappointed. This is not a hotel per se, but rather a collection of 4 apartments in a building not far from the main train station (termin). There will be someone to receive you, to serve you breakfast and clean your room, but do not expect a 24 hour service as in a real full scale hotel. We have reserved two double rooms, but when we came, one of the rooms was upgraded to a suite. The rooms ar very well equiped, and looked like they were very recently renovated with a very modern touch (flat screen TV, laptop, etc.). The suite had a bath/jacuzi inside the room, which I did not think very convenient, and also the lights near the bed were rather dim. In this respect I felt that he double room, though a little smaller, was more convenient. We also has once a problem with the hot water and had to wait a while for the water to get hot again, Overall, very clean and pleasant and I also appreciated the restaurant recommendations, of where the Italians actually go to eat. We tried most of them and they were all very good. The only question about the place is its location. If you, like us, plan to walk all day in Rome, then the hotel is not situated such that you can take a mid-day rest, unless you take public transportation back to it (we walked from it to most places, except the Vatican where you can take the subway). Other than that I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Bellisimo”
Reviews.Author: 1Princessa
Reviews.Content: Im pretty fussy about where I stay so after weeks of searching for a reasonably priced hotel in central Rome (very difficult), I settled on the WRH Suites. I spent three nights there in the twin/double room which to be honest is quite small but I was hardly ever in it so it didnt worry me at all. Its located about 3 minutes from Termini which is handy for the Metro/Bus and about 10 -15 minutes walk to the Forum/Colleseum and a further 5-10 mintues to Piazza Navona and the Spanish Steps etc. The immediate area the front of the station is a little dodgy but nothing to worry about at all. To get to the hotel you literally walk out the front of the train station, turn left, walk straight over the road where the shops are. There is a man on the corner selling fruit and vegetables and that is the street you walk down. Its number 69 so just follow the numbers and its across the road from a sports store. My room was really modern, clean, had air conditioning, 100's of tv channels to watch, internet access and was really quiet thanks to the double glazed shutters. The maid even folded my pyjamas up every day and put them on my pillow. At night there is a bar called the Druids Rock about 3 minutes walk going in the opposite direction to the station. Its a cheesy Irish bar full of tourists but handy for a drink on the way home from a busy days sight seeing. I wouldnt worry about missing breakfast in the morning, it was basically bran flakes, a couple of different cheese's and a couple of pastries. One day we were lucky enough to be given toast but the next day there was a different lady there and she couldnt even work the coffee machine let alone make toast. Its not a big deal as there are plenty of places near by to pick up breakfast or grab a slice of pizza. Overall I would highly recommend it and would definitely stay there again. Just remember to bring comfy shoes with you as my calf muscles and feet have never ached so much after 3 days of solid walking.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves to be well known!”
Reviews.Author: gk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the WRH suites based on two things - a few positive reviews on Tripadvisor and the photograps on their website. All I can say is, my expectations were met and greatly exceeded mostly by the pleasant staff who would bend over backwards to help you out. We arrived on a late train on saturday night, but Tomaso was there to greet us and pick out all the great spots for us to visit as well as a few restaurant recommendations. He was even kind enough to call us when we hadn't shown up in time just to make sure we were on the right track! The room we stayed in was the Junior Suite and it was simply stunning. Modern, clean, spacious - perfect! It's also a lot bigger than it looks like on the website. The jacuzzi was an absolute godsend. Like somebody else said, after a day's walking around Rome, it was the perfect end to the day to spend a bit of time in there! There was an computer connected to the internet provided (very helpful!) an in-room safe, phone, lots of storage space and a mini-bar as well. The breakfast at the WRH Suites was also excellent with fresh brioches, toast, ham, cheese, fruits, yoghurt, cereal and someone there to make you a hot cup of coffee. Lovely! We found the location to be excellent - we caught the buses or the metro everywhere in Rome and Termini station was a 2 minute walk away. If you're having trouble finding the place, here's a tip: walk to the very end of the Station Termini where it meets the Piazza Cinquecento. This is the outside area where all the buses and taxis congregate. Once you're outside, turn to your left to face via G. Giolitti. There is a row of shops set back from the normal run of shops and the first street on the left is the one WRH Suites is on - via D. Manin. You'll also recognise it because it has tram tracks running down it. So, if you start from just outside Termini station, you should have no trouble finding it. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel to any other travellers in Rome. It's close to transport links, stylish, friendly and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem, But Not For Everyone”
Reviews.Author: 2BAnonymous
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our recent three-night stay at the WRH Suites (a.k.a., Arthouse Rome). We were warmly received upon our arrival - even given coffee and breakfast - and allowed into our room much earlier than we expected. We were very pleased with what we found... The junior suite was just as their website represented - contemporary in styling, clean and comfortable. Having a laptop with a highspeed connection was a brilliant touch. And even better, its use is free (handy for daily checking weather and researching the area). The staff is very friendly, approachable and quick to offer assistance. Shortly after our arrival, we had already been given a map and a few suggestions to make the most of our Rome experience. Assistance was even given for arranging hard to come by museum tickets. Now that is good service. I would recommend paying for your stay in cash. The discount given - almost 10% - is too good to pass up. Now for the part that makes the WRH Suites not for everyone: since this a boutique hotel and not a large, fully-staffed operation, it will not appeal to the traveler that likes to walk into a large and active lobby and have a staff at your disposal 24 hours a day. Instead, you are given keys to the building and the hotel and your comings and goings are more self-directed. We had absolutely no issue with this (as it was clearly stated on their website), but I recognize that this will not work for everyone. [In fairness, too, emergency numbers for the staff are provided so if something were to come up you would not be on your own.] Also, the walk up to the building is not all that great and the lobby of the building could use a fresh coat of paint. The small nits aside, the WRH Suites is a reasonably-priced oasis in a convenient location only a short walk to the Termini station and no more than 20 minutes by foot to most attractions. It is perfect for the independently-minded traveler. We would definitely stay here each time we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sinyc
Reviews.Content: Just came back from spending 5 nights at WRH Suites. Great location, 2 1/2 block from the Termini. This little b&b is clean with modern design. Staff was friendly (Tomaso, and maid), and helpful. They offer a variety of selection for breakfast (Typical Cereal, Yogurt, Fresh Fruits, and Toast). We got upgraded to the suite/triple. The room was hugh, and comes with a open tub/shower jacuzzi, and a laptop with DSL connection. It feels like home. The most important thing is I feel pretty safe walking down the street at night and it's walking distance to most attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely accomodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in WRH Suites in Rome and the accomodation was very comfortable, lovely and modern. The staff, very friendly. The relation between price and quality of accomodation was very good.It is situated just three blocks from the Rome Termini Station and that permit to go by walking to different atractions in the city. It is a place that I strongly recommend to anyboody who want to spend a nice time in Rome and take a good rest.
